name: Denny Hulme
introduction: Denis Clive "Denny" Hulme OBE (born June 18, 1936 in Motueka, New Zealand  died October 4, 1992 in Bathurst, New South Wales, Australia) was a racing driver from New Zealand who raced in Formula One, winning the World Championship in 1967.  He drove for only two teams in his career, Brabham and McLaren.  He often raced in the Can-Am series and drove in the Indianapolis 500 four times, finishing fourth twice.
